meanings.definition: A prickly climbing plant with hooked thorns.
meanings.sent1: The catbriers scratched my arm as I tried to climb over them.
meanings.sent2: Be careful of the catbriers when walking through the forest.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel got tangled in the catbriers and had a hard time escaping.
meanings.sent4: Her words were like catbriers, leaving painful marks on his heart.
meanings.sent5: The catbriers twisted around the fence, making it impossible to pass.

meanings.definition: A plant of the genus Smilax, typically having thorny stems.
meanings.sent1: The catbriers in the garden added a wild touch to the landscape.
meanings.sent2: The catbriers grew vigorously in the humid climate of the rainforest.
meanings.sent3: The catbriers seemed to play a game of tag with the other plants in the garden.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts were tangled like catbriers, making it hard to focus.
meanings.sent5: The catbriers intertwined with the roses, creating a beautiful but prickly display.

meanings.sent1: The catbriers near the river provided a natural barrier.
meanings.sent2: The catbriers twisted around the old oak tree, giving it a wild appearance.
meanings.sent3: The catbriers seemed to have a secret dance party in the moonlight.
meanings.sent4: His anger was like catbriers, sharp and difficult to handle.
meanings.sent5: The catbriers in the field caught the sunlight, creating a dazzling effect.
